reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Things started off bad when we had to wait 45 minutes for the shuttle. Called twice and another person waiting also called twice. It is less than a ten minute ride when we finally got on the old beat-up van with a paper sign taped on the door. I thought later, anyone could drive up in a van like that one and take us anywhere
reviews.title: 45 minute wait for airport shuttle

reviews.text: Check in was okay and we got a room on the concierge floor. Lounge was minimum and unlike other Renaissance Hotels we had to pay for a glass of wine. Person serving in lounge sat on her butt and was of little help.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for good price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had dinner in restaurant and staff there was good and tried to make up for prior problems. Chris did a great job.
reviews.title: One Night Stop - LOUD LOUD LOUD

reviews.text: Missed breakfast, which was probably not a loss, because of an early flight.
reviews.title: Close to PPL park and downtown.. near the airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the past we have stayed at Airport Marriott ( no shuttle, can walk to hotel). It was full so we tried the Renaissance - never again.
reviews.title: Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is by far the worst Marriott I have ever encountered. I am a Marriott Platinum member and even though we were upgraded to a top floor on one night and a handicap suite on another night, the rooms were still run-down and the carpet in the suite was damp on one side of the bed. The walls are paper thin and we were interrupted with loud voices coming through the vents in the early hours of the morning. The front desk staff was apologetic but no actions were taken to resolve the noise. I have contact the Marriott's customer service and they have in turn contacted the upper management of the hotel. Stay here at your own risk! I will never stay here again.
reviews.title: Terrible Service, Noisy Room, Damp Carpet

reviews.text: The hotel was great-very clean and it was a comfy place to come back to after a day in Philly. Overall, our stay was great and I would stay here again but ONLY if we could get a room that doesnt have a balcony facing the pool. It was extremely noisy. We had a hard time falling asleep even with our sound machine on. I believe that the pool was supposed to close at 11pm and it was so loud right up until then with people screaming and just being generally obnoxious. On our second night we were actually woken up by a ton of noise around 1am and I thought it was people arguing in the hall but it was actually people who snuck into the pool area and decided to have a drunken party. The parking was also somewhat of an obstacle. It was free parking, which was excellent but it was very hard to find a place to park because the hotel was so busy.
reviews.title: The hotel was great-the other guests..not so much

reviews.text: Our hotel accomodations were provided us with an excellant view of the nature reserve which surrounds the Renaissance. The room was clean, and the hotel provides a single serve coffe and teas. The beds are very comfy. The staff was helpful.
reviews.title: LOVED IT!

reviews.text: My only complaint is that the wi-fi isn't free!
reviews.title: Great service, Great staff... we'll be back, for sure!

reviews.text: We spent last weekend at the Renaissance Hotel in Philadelphia (near the airport), and were so happy with the service we received. It's an older property, but still maintains the high standards you come to expect from a Marriott/Renaissance hotel. We immediately felt so welcomed by the front desk staff member who checked us in (Patrick). His bright & friendly personality was just what we needed after a long drive. He quickly checked us in, and gave us all the information we needed about the hotel (gym, pool, restaurants, parking, etc.).
reviews.title: Clean, Conveniently located Hotel-Our second stay!

reviews.text: Was concerned based upon reviews. Found this place great! Love the AVEDA products!
reviews.title: ExcelGreat place to stay

reviews.text: I really liked this hotel. The rooms are nice, modern and very clean. I also appreciated that they were quite quiet. Staff made checkin and checkout quick and painless. And there was a shuttle that left to the airport every twenty minutes which made it convenient to get into downtown Philadelphia. However, the shuttles were often late, which was kind of annoying to try and be able to plane your arrival to the airport. That was my only negative about the hotel.
reviews.title: Very nice airport hotel

reviews.text: The room was spacious however needs to be updated. I have stayed at MUCH nicer Renaissance hotels - not sure why this one wasn't up to par. I was happy that they had a "real" hair dryer in the bathroom - I am not a fan of the ones attached to the walls. The Aveda hair products were also a nice touch. I had the crunchy french toast for breakfast - it arrived promptly for when I ordered it (put the order card on my door the night before) in the morning and it was quite good. Probably would try a different hotel at the Philly airport next time I stay there. Other hotels seems closer to the airport and easier to find. Though ok, this one didn't win me over.
reviews.title: Average at Best

reviews.text: The lobby staff made a valiant effort at trying to make me happy, but the physical installations were beyond their customer service. The hotel desperately needs renovation.
reviews.title: Lost its Luster Long Ago

reviews.text: I stayed here one night paying a meeting rate of $129 plus tax for a total of $141.
reviews.title: Adequate

reviews.text: I am a frequent business traveler and have spent about 80 nights in hotels this year thus far and this was one of my most disappointing experiences. The lobby and entrance of the hotel are clean and in order but the rooms leave a lot to be desired. I stayed in Room 521 and awoke with more than a dozen bug bites on my calves, ankles and feet. I had inspected the bed the night I arrived and while the mattress looked very worn I didn't see much to be concerned about at the time. The next morning under closer inspection (with more daylight) I found the bed to be quite dirty with stains on the sides and corners...there was a mattress pad and cover but they were littered with pubic hair and I found several small, dead bugs on the mattress under the mattress pad. They did not appear to be bed bugs but I could not identify them, even upon closer inspection with a camera. There was a chaise lounge in the room that had stains all over it as well. I awoke in the middle of the night running a fever and feeling very sick, which is probably when I was being bitten, but didn't know it at the time. I also used the exercise room in the morning which I found to be quite dirty as well. I've stayed at many Renaissance hotels and generally find them to be very clean and nice places to stay but this hotel does not match up to the Renaissance standard. I did report the bug problem to the front desk so they are aware of it and did some online research when I got home and the bugs resemble snow fleas.
reviews.title: Attacked by bugs while I slept

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reason I pose that question is that this hotel has many good aspects, and some not-so-good aspects. It's not terrible...it's okay, depending on your requirements.
reviews.title: What are your priorities?

reviews.text: Not-so-good:
reviews.title: Average for Marriott brand.

reviews.text: We paid for access to the concierge lounge. Not worth it. It's open from 5 to 10 p.m. then opens again for breakfast until 10 a.m. You can't even pick up a bottle of water outside of the alotted time frame. The evening service was nice; the lady attending stayed on top of keeping the tables clean and the food and beverages fresh.
reviews.title: Not bad for Airport

reviews.text: We stopped in for breakfast early the next morning, and I'm sorry to say it was mediocre. Another lady was attending, and maybe it was too much for her to handle by herself. The coffee and hot water carafes were allowed to sit empty for an extended period of time, the tables were not wiped clean through several 'waves' of guests coming through. The 'scambled eggs' sat in yellow water puddles at the bottom of the server. They ran out of items and when guests asked for them the lady had to tell them that she didn't have it; in fact the entire hotel ran out of the same items. Poor lady - not her fault. She was nice. C'mon HOTEL MANAGER - send someone to the nearest supermarket and buy the items guests are requesting. Bananas, milk for the kids' cereal...not exotic, hard-to-find items. Surprisingly, the counter area that held the warm foods (oatmeal and scrambled eggs) had 4 light sconces on the walls above. I almost took a picture with my cell phone to post here. They were hanging off the wall at different angles, the shades half off. The handle on the little acrylic case holding the bagels and bread slices actually partially came off when I opened it. It was hanging by one screw. This is not a "concierge lounge." Do not pay for it.
reviews.title: Free parking is a plus
